remarks: Split off the first ` N ` terms of an infinite sum.  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 9-Feb-2008.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2014.)
statement:
isumsplit.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
isumsplit.2 $e |- W = ( ZZ>= ` N ) $.
isumsplit.3 $e |- ( ph -> N e. Z ) $.
isumsplit.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) = A ) $.
isumsplit.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> A e. CC ) $.
isumsplit.6 $e |- ( ph -> seq M ( + , F ) e. dom ~~> ) $.
isumsplit $p |- ( ph -> sum_ k e. Z A = ( sum_ k e. ( M ... ( N - 1 ) ) A + sum_ k e. W A ) ) $.
